title: BP appoints insider Bernard Looney as chief after £100m man Bob Dudley retires
text:
Bob Dudley is stepping down as boss of BP after pocketing £100m for his work restoring the oil firm's reputation in the wake of the Deepwater Horizon disaster.

A four-decade veteran of the company, Mr Dudley replaced Tony Hayward as chief executive in 2010 following the oil spill that killed 11 people and unleashed environmental havoc across thousands of miles.

The catastrophe has cost BP more than $65bn (£52.7bn) in compensation, penalties and clean-up costs.

Mr Dudley, 64, spent the last 10 years battling to save the reputation of the FTSE 100 oil major and preparing it for the rise of lower carbon alternatives to oil and gas.
